body.p: Which drug would be effective in reducing gastric ulcers in someone infected with Helicobacter pylori?

response.feedback: Incorrect. These would inhibit the symptoms of inflammation but not affect the bacteria.
Incorrect. These would reduce the acidity of the gastric juice temporarily, but not affect the bacteria.
Incorrect. These would reduce the release of hydrochloric acid in the gastric juice, but not affect the bacteria.
Correct. By killing the bacteria linked to the formation of gastric ulcers, the ulcers are able to heal.

part.hint: The bacterium is adapted to the acidic environment of the stomach and does not invade into the cells themselves, so the drug would come in contact with the bacteria in the stomach.
